intro: Cupaniopsis neoebudensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorean cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
